resources.description:
Local sites (ie sites designated locally for their substantive nature conservation importance, either for wildlife or geology). 

These sites are being managed so as to preserve their nature conservation interest (ie are in “positive conservation management”).

The data allows assessment of the proportion (percentage) of the total number of local sites in Herefordshire where positive conservation management is being implemented, or has been in the last 5 years. 

Assessing the extent of positive management can help to identify sites where such management is lacking. This will help to concentrate the efforts of local site partnerships in ensuring the sites are managed appropriately, and their nature conservation value is maintained or enhanced.
resources.name: Local sites in positive management in Herefordshire.
Local sites in positive conservation management in Herefordshire

organization.description:
This is the community datastore for Herefordshire. [Here is a post about what the datastore is and why you should care](http://h-map.org.uk/2016/05/06/what-is-the-herefordshire-datastore-and-why-should/).


Part of the [Brightspace Foundation Route Map project](http://h-map.org.uk/).

We blog over at the [Route Map blog](http://h-map.org.uk/category/all-posts/).

If you'd like to add data here, you'll need a datahub.io account. Then [contact the RouteMap project](http://h-map.org.uk/contact-us/).
organization.title: Herefordshire
organization.name: hdata

name: local-sites-in-positive-conservation-management-in-herefordshire
notes: Extracted from the [ENV10 dataset published by Defra](https://www.gov.uk/government/statistical-data-sets/env10-local-sites-in-positive-conservation-management). No reports have been recorded for Herefordshire since  the financial year ending March 2012.
title: Local sites in positive conservation management in herefordshire
